column9:
A refreshing, fruity and dry white wine, with flavours of fresh peach, lime and hints of Mediterranean herbs. A delicious, easy-drinking English wine with a smooth zesty finish. A perfect match for every dinner.

All our wines are vegan friendly.

Choose this wine if you like...

Pinot Grigio, Albariño

Food pairing suggestions

Pasta, fish and chicken dishes, grilled veggies, creamy sauces, cheese platters, appetisers, and olives.
column10:
Winemaking

A blend of three grape varieties, this is a multi-vintage wine, which means that the grapes have been picked in different years in order to combine the best features of each vintage. Fermented at a low temperature in stainless-steel vessels, the wine is also aged shortly on the lees to add texture to its naturally fruity and refreshing character.

 

Keep horizontally in a dry and dark place, away from heat, sunlight and vibrations.

 

Grape varieties

Optima, Reichensteiner, Gewürztraminer and Schönburger, in various proportions according to the batch.

 

Alcohol

11%

 

Name & Label

Named after the Henley Regatta which takes place only a few miles from Stanlake Park. The label features a charming watercolour water lily, a flower frequently seen along the River Thames.

 

Label artist

Benedict Butterworth

Winemaking

A blend of Chardonnay and Ortega grapes. Fermented in stainless-steel vessels, aged on the lees with occasional stirring, and matured in a combination of old and new French oak barrels for two years. Keep horizontally in a dry and dark place, away from heat, sunlight and vibrations.

column10:
Winemaking

Made from grapes grown in our winemaker's family vineyard, located in the rural area of Lecce and Brindisi in Puglia, Italy. The grapes are hand-picked, typically during the last week of August in the early morning, to retain freshness. Bunches are destemmed before a 6-hour cold maceration is carried out to extract a bright, salmon colour. Fermented at 15-16 °C and aged in stainless steel vessels.  

Keep in a dry and dark place, away from heat, sunlight and vibrations.

 

Grape Variety

Primitivo 100%

 

Current Vintage

2022

Winemaking

Made from grapes grown in our winemaker's family vineyard, located in the rural area of Brindisi in Puglia, Italy. The grapes are hand-picked in the early morning to retain freshness, followed by 6-8 hours of skin contact to maximise the extraction of flavour and texture. Soft pressed and fermented at 16-17°C for 10-12 days. Aged on the lees for 3 months, then bottled.   Keep in a dry and dark place, away from heat, sunlight and vibrations.  

Grape Variety

Fiano 100%

2022

column10:
Winemaking

Made from grapes grown in our winemaker's family vineyard, located in the rural area of Brindisi in Puglia, Italy. The  grapes are hand-picked in the early morning to retain freshness, typically in September. They are then destemmed and fermented in stainless steel vessels at 22-24°C for 8-10 days with daily pump-overs. Malolactic conversion occurs after fermentation; the wine is then aged in oak barrels for 4 months.  

Keep in a dry and dark place, away from heat, sunlight and vibrations.

 

Grape Variety

Negroamaro 100%

 

Current Vintage

2021

 

Alcohol

13.5%

A slightly sparkling, refreshing English wine made in the traditional method. Elegant flavours of white flowers, ripe citrus, quince and apples. Perfect well-chilled on a summer's day. A smoother, more flavoursome and delicate alternative to Prosecco. 

This non-vintage English sparkling wine is made with Pinot Noir and Seyval blanc grapes using the Traditional Method, the same technique used for Champagne and other famous sparkling wines in the world. The wine is aged for 12 months after a short second fermentation in the bottle, which gives a just slightly sparkling character, usually known as 'frizzante' in Italy. 

All our wines are vegan friendly.

Food pairing suggestions

Enjoy on its own or with buttery and creamy starters or sauces. Particularly standing out with fruit tarts, lemon pie, mousse and creamy desserts.

A lovely English Orange Wine, with intense aromas of wild flowers, orange zest, cantaloupe melon and ripe peach, and an exceptional texture perfectly balanced by a crisp body, followed by a long finish. Made with the skin contact technique. 

All our wines are vegan friendly.

Choose this wine if you like...

Pinot Gris, Marsanne, Semillon

Food pairing suggestions

Scallops, oysters, sheep’s milk cheese and spicy foods such as Indian or Asian Cuisines.
column10:
Winemaking

This Orange wine was made with mature Siegerrebe grapes, with one week of skin contact, and was fermented in oak barrels. By soaking with the skins, the grape juice acquires extra fruit and tropical aromas, an oily, mouth-filling texture and a very persistent finish.

 

The wine is not 'orange' in colour, and absolutely not made adding oranges or orange juice - the word refers to a very ancient winemaking technique, known also as skin contact for white wines. When white grape juice is kept in contact with grape skins, and particularly when carried out in an oxidative environment (such as amphorae), the wine might adopt orange tinges.

 

At Stanlake Park, we've chosen to avoid oxidation in order to retain the fresh and delicate fruit aromas, so the colour of our wine is more white than orange, but it has been produced using this ancient technique.

 

We prefer low-intervention winemaking, including natural cold stabilisation and a very coarse filtration, in order to retain the wine's natural structure. As a consequence, a small crystalline deposit can occur in bottle, but this is completely harmless.

 

Keep horizontally in a dry and dark place, away from heat, sunlight and vibrations.

 

Grape Variety

Siegerrebe

 

Current Vintage

2024

 

Alcohol

11%

 

Label Artist

Benedict Butterworth

Awards

  • T&CVA Wine Challenge - Silver Medal (2022)

column9:
Spring is in full swing and that also means it's time to release our new rosé vintage! Our very best-selling pink is coming back soon: the Pinot Noir Rosé 2022. You can now preorder your case of six here, with a 15% discount.

The 2022 vintage

The 2022 was a great vintage for Stanlake Park. An uncomplicated winter, a spring with no frost or disease, and a hot, very dry summer allowed our grapes to fully ripen (yes, we actually had summer last year in England, yay!). With those almost perfect conditions, Nico has managed to grow an excellent quality crop of Pinot Noir, which allowed us to make again the pale and refreshing rosé everybody loves!

Our Pinot Noir Rosé is always the most popular of our wines and the 2020 vintage was considered one of the best rosé in the world, having won a Silver Medal at the Global Rosé Masters, an international competition organised by TheDrinksBusiness magazine. Every year, our Pinot Noir Rosé sells out before the following vintage is ready - no matter how much we make.

This is a very pale, dry and refreshing rosé, with delicate flavours of raspberry, passionfruit and fresh peach. Can it get any better? We don't think so. Grab your case now, as it will sell out again, that's a promise.
column10:

column9:
Celebrate with us the taste of some of our best wines, which were recently awarded a Silver Medal each at T&CVA Annual Competition!

This is an annual competition organised by the Thames & Chiltern Valley Vineyards Association. The contest is open to all wines made in the region, which includes Berkshire, Buckinghamshire and Oxfordshire. The judge panel leader, Patricia Stefanowicz MW, commented that the variety in style and taste of the wines this year was very wide.

Both our versions of the grape variety Bacchus, the still and the sparkling, together with our Heritage Brut, were recognised by the judges as great examples of their category, and were given a Silver Medal.

To celebrate, we're given a mixed case of these wines with a 10% discount. Grab yours now!

Offer valid online only. Click & Collect from our Cellar Door available.
column10:

  • 2 bottles of Bacchus Brut, green apple and gooseberry notes, with delicate bubbles and a crispy character;
  • 2 bottles of Heritage Brut, a traditional sparkling wine with aromas of fresh apples and hints of toast.

Buy this mixed case and save 10% compared to buying the items individually.

column9: Pinot Low gently captures the essence of our premium Pinot Noir Rosé wine, balancing taste with a lower alcohol content. Our winemaker's expertise, using earlier grape picking and lower extraction, has crafted a rosé that fits perfectly into the contemporary world of mindful drinking.  Light in alcohol but not in flavour, it shows delicate hints of red cherry, citrus and subtle mineral undertones, with a refreshing body. Vegan friendly.  Pinot Low is a delicious choice for any occasion, especially warm afternoons and fun picnics, allowing you to reduce your alcohol and calorie intake without sacrificing flavour.
column10:
Winemaking

This wine-based drink is made with early-picked Pinot Noir grapes, that have very low sugar levels and therefore, their final alcohol content is lower than usual. After crushing follows a short maceration on the skins to extract a delicate colour, with fermentation taking place at a cool temperature in stainless steel tanks to retain freshness.   The bottle has no plastic or metal capsule to avoid unnecessary packaging. A simpler look for a more sustainable future!
  Keep horizontally in a dry and dark place, away from heat, sunlight and vibrations.  

Grape Variety

100% Pinot noir

Current Vintage

2024

Alcohol

5%

column9: Berkshire Breeze is the ultimate crowd-pleaser. Made with Madeleine Angevine grapes and natural peach flavour, this refreshing drink perfectly combines the soft, delicious character of ripe peach with a crisp, citrusy profile. Very flavoursome, with a medium body, a fleshy finish and a slightly off-dry character.  All our wines are vegan friendly. Best served very chilled. Delightful on its own, or for an extra refreshing twist, serve it over ice with a sprig of mint and a slice of fresh peach. Great also as a cocktail ingredient and for a spritz. Perfect alongside vibrant green salads, grilled fish and fruit tart.
column10:
Winemaking

This aromatised wine-based drink is made with Madeleine Angevine grapes fermented at a low temperature in stainless-steel vessels to retain the delicate floral characteristics. Aged for a few months in neutral vessels before release, and then aromatised with natural peach essence.   The bottle has no plastic or metal capsule to avoid unnecessary packaging. A simpler look for a more sustainable future!
  Keep horizontally in a dry and dark place, away from heat, sunlight and vibrations.  

Grape Variety

100% Madeleine Angevine

 

Alcohol

11%
